Her mouth purses, and I can see sad memories flickering in her eyes. "Of course, the other two were too angry with me to believe it. The thing is, Mom thinks Grandma was trying to help us, not hurt us. She probably only wanted us to stay away from each other and to end up with men, and never considered the possibility one of us might be turning guys into girls instead."

"So your cousin is also..." I don't know how to end the sentence, but Pam nods.

"Yes, but she loved the butch type, and the very first one she changed into a guy ended up liking it. They're married, with two kids and a nice house now."

I stay silent. Really, I have no idea what to say next. What the hell do you say in this situation?

Pam does though. "You have two questions you need to ask."

"What?"

"Do you stay this way all the time, and is there any way to fix it?"
1521.title: Pam remembers sex with male me and knows who I am.

15211.content:
"Okay, so what's the answer"

Pam looks away, shame coloring her eyes. "I... I know that for as long as I kept track of them, the other two stayed switched. As for fixing it... they wouldn't give me the chance to try to find something. Mom wanted to try, but she needed one of them as an example, and they wouldn't go."

"I don't understand that. For a chance to fix it..."

She stays silent for a long pause, then finally speaks in a broken whisper.

"I... it's my fault. I didn't tell either of them about Mom right away. I even acted like I didn't know what caused it at first. So they didn't trust me at all by that point." She purses her lips and adds, "I guess I've grown up a little since then."

After some silence, I say, "I don't know what to think about this, but I appreciate you telling me up front."

She smiles sadly. "So, are you going to go see my mother with me?"

"She's a witch too?"

"Not as good as Grandma. Being half-Gypsy, Gypsy magic doesn't work as well for her. I'm a quarter, so I can't do mch more than give people bad luck and mess with the odds in gambling games."

I think for a bit, then shrug. "I don't know that I have any choice."

"What do you mean?"

"Well I can't go to work on Monday like this. What the hell else am I going to do?"

"Oh." She said nodding. "I see."

She sits up. While I'm helping her look for her clothes, she tells me,

1521111.content:
It turns out to be a long drive, out of the city and far off into the country side.

That turns out to be good and bad.

Bad in that I had to endure the constant bouncing and jiggling of my new breasts during the interminable, bumpy car trip. If I was going to be stuck as “Brenda” for any foreseeable amount of time, I would have to invest in a bra. Nothing too frilly or girly. Maybe just a sports bra would do. It too bad, I reflected, that Granny's curse hadn't given me a whole new wardrobe. Or maybe it had, I thought with a sinking sensation of horror. If my ID card had changed, perhaps my apartment had changed too. Just because I wasn't wearing a bra and panties right now didn't mean there weren't drawers full of the damned things back at my place.

Hmmm, best to think of others things.

The long car trip proved good in that I finally got the chance to calm down a bit and reflect on what's happened. There's an old Latin phrase I remember from college: In vino veritas – “In wine there is truth.” We tend to do and say things drunk that we'd never do or say sober. Everyone knows that. But often the things that slip past the censor of sobriety are the painful truths we try so hard to keep hidden. Alcohol loosens up the tongue and allows us to utter aloud difficult truths – in slightly slurred speech, of course. In my case, the truth was that I had always been attracted to Pam. And not just physically. She was hot, don't get me wrong! But she was also a warm, friendly person with a great sense of humor. We had always really clicked together. But perhaps because she was so hot, I'd always viewed her as being unapproachable. In short, I was a chickenshit coward and hadn't ever tried asking her out because I believed she was out of my league. It was a shame really, because according to Granny Gypsy's curse, Pam and I are practically soul-mates.

Okay, yeah that sounds sappy and all melodramatically romantic. But I really and truly liked Pam. This hadn't been a mere drunken one-night stand. If anything, the real pity of it all was that we were both too drunk to remember what had happened. If I hadn't required such volumes of liquid courage before propositioning Pam, perhaps last night could have been a more magical evening?

“Again, I'm sorry about my grandmother's magic intruding on us last evening,” Pam said, breaking the silence. “Thanks for not hating me.”

“Of course I don't hate you, Pam!” I laughed with my girlish new voice. Ugh, it sounds almost like a giggle now. “You're a pretty cool person. I've always enjoyed working with you at the office. I'm really glad we finally hooked up … I mean, I'm not thrilled about the circumstances of course!”

I gestured down at the monstrous new melons, bouncing freely under my t-shirt.

“But what I mean is, I guess I think your grandmother's spell was right,” I continue. “We're good for each other, I think. And, maybe after your mom straightens out this curse, we should keep seeing each other? If you want. I really like you, Pam.”

Whew! Why was that so hard for me to say?

I'm actually finding it easier to be a girl than to ask one out!

And in this case, the one I'm asking out is somebody I've already slept with, even!

The heart is truly a weird, fucked up thing. Not an eloquent way of putting it, I know – but it's true.

“Thanks, Brad,” Pam replies softly. She leans over and kisses me briefly. “Or should I call you Brenda?”

“Better call me Brenda,” I answer with a forced laugh. “You and I are probably the only ones who remember good old Brad. Man, I hope your mom can help reverse this.”

“We'll soon find out,” Pam says. “This is the old farmhouse, right up ahead!”
1521111.title: Reflections on Truth

152111121.content:
Pam's mother Roxana proved to be an attractive woman who had aged gracefully. I could definitely see the family resemblance between mother and daughter. Though she had a few more wrinkles, a tinge of gray in her hair, and a couple of extra pounds around the midsection, Pam's mom was otherwise the spitting image of her daughter.

She also proved to be a sympathetic audience.

I let Pam do most of the talking and spent my own time sitting quietly on the couch and resisting the urge to stare at the swollen new assets on my chest.

“Oh dear, you kids really have yourselves in a pickle now, don't you,” Roxana said with a gentle, welcoming smile. “Would either of you care for a slice of pie? It's in the oven and should be done shortly.”

I politely shook my head no.

“Mom, we don't need pie,” insisted Pam. “We need Brad's sexuality restored. And we need Granny's ridiculous curse lifted from me. You don't know what kind of a living hell it's been for me living in abstinence like this for so long. I can't go on this way, mom.”

“Oh, there's the oven,” said Roxana, rising from her chair to go answer the chiming oven bell in the kitchen. “I'll bring you girls each a slice of pie and some milk.”

“Mom! Brad is not a girl,” sighed Pam.

“Do you really think she can help us?” I asked Pam once her mom had left the room.

“If she can't, nobody can,” Pam answered, suddenly unable to look me in the eye. “Granny was very wise and extraordinarily powerful. Mom has not only inherited that gypsy bloodline but was also taught directly by granny.”

I said nothing but looked dubiously in the direction of the kitchen.

“Look, I know she's in June Cleaver mode right now,” Pam replied, sensing my skepticism. “But mom really is a top notch spell-caster.”

Roxana returned with two slices of fresh, hot pie and a pair of glasses full of cold milk.

“Here you go, girls,” she said with cheerful smile.

I accepted graciously and did not correct my hostess as to the true nature of my gender.

“Now the two of you enjoy a good wholesome snack while I do the talking,” Roxana said. “I've been thinking about your dilemma Pam, and there may be answer for you. And for you as well, Brenda. However, you might not like the solution I have in mind.”

“With all due respect, ma'am,” I said as politely as possible. “I think we're willing to do just about anything to remove this curse. Just let us now what's involved in the fix you have in mind. I can't imagine it can be much worse than the current situation.”

“Sometimes we have to destroy the lives we have in order to achieve the lives we are meant for,” Roxana said cryptically.

“I don't follow you, mom,” Pam replied. “Just what are you trying to say?”

“Nothing in life is free,” Roxana answered. “And there is a price the two of you must pay in order for balance to be restored. Are you sure you want to do this?”

“We already told you, mom,” said Pam. “We'll pay the price.”

“Pam, I say this to you now not as your mother but rather as your spiritual mentor,” said Roxana somberly. “Don't rush into this. The great power of the universe works through change and transformation in order for each of us to discover our true nature. As our destinies are revealed, we strike a balance finally with the great harmony of the world. Remember: happiness is harmony. And beauty and style, harmony and grace, peace and the rhythms of the universe all depend on the graceful simplicity of balance. Strike a balance and cultivate your harmony.”

“Mom, this isn't harmony,” protested Pam. “Everyone I sleep with undergoes a spontaneous sex change operation! This isn't balance or harmony. I want to be a normal girl. And I want Brenda to be a normal guy.”

I winced at being called Brenda again, but otherwise kept still my tongue. Things were strictly between mother and daughter at this point. I sensed it would be imprudent to interfere.

“Out of clutter, discover simplicity,” said Roxana enigmatically. “Out of discord, discovery harmony. And out of difficulty, discover opportunity.”

“This isn't an opportunity, mom,” insisted Pam. “Please – just tell us what price needs to be paid.”

Roxana was silently for a long while before answering.

“The curse can be lifted if …”
152111121.title: Pam's mother gives advice

152311.content:
“Man, you were drunk last night,” giggles Pam. “You don't even recognize him?”

You shake your head no.

“I can see him sleeping on the floor,” says Pam. “Right over there. The old skinny guy with the Fu Manchu mustache.”

Now you easily spot the prestidigitator in question: a bony, gray-haired figure wearing a ratty old stained oriental robe. The magician (and his clothing) had both clearly seen better days. Probably why they were able to hire the old coot for a private party. Under normal circumstances, you'd think a wizard capable of conducting legitimate, instant sex change operations would be in high demand to play Las Vegas or Atlantic City … or more likely Trinidad, Colorado!

“Hey, wake up!” you say, not so gently kicking the slumbering, skeletal scarecrow of a human being snoring on the floor. “Are you the Spectacular Sham-a-ling Dong-Ding?”

“It's the Amazing Sen Shu Al,” corrected Pam.

“He can call himself Amazing Grace for all I care,” you grumble, kicking the slumbering magician again. “Just wake him up and have him change me back!”

“I stir, I stir, my good lady,” said Sen Shu Al grumpily as he rose to his unsteady feet. “Who wakens me from my Sherry-induced languor?”

“You drank a third of bottle of Everclear, then passed out,” frowns Pam. “There was no Sherry involved.”

“Yes, well, there is that then,” said Sen Shu Al, blinking his liquor-reddened eyes blearily and holding one hand to his temple. “Now my dear ladies, I do require a cup of warm elixir – just a tasse à café of that delicious ambrosia of the gods …”

“Change me back into a dude!” you snap, interrupting the rambling conjurer.

“All in good time, dear woman. All in good time,” said Sen Shu Al calmly. “But first, we must remedy the painful pounding in my head. Please if you will good women, just a drop of that powerful potion brewed from the java bean, to steady my nerves – that nectar of caffeine, mahogany decoction of berries from the sweet, flowering Coffea arabica plant, which doth …”

“What the hell are you going on about?” you growl rudely at the babbling buffoon.

“He wants a cup of coffee,” says Pam with a yawn. “I could use one myself.”

“And I believe it was specified in my contract,” the old magician helpfully pointed out.

“You didn't have a contract,” corrected Pam.

“We had a verbal contract,” said Sen Shu Al.

“We promised you the last third of that bottle of Everclear to perform,” said Pam. “You drank it, switched around the naughty bits of a few party guests, then passed out. There was no promise of coffee the next morning.”

“Just get him a damned cup of coffee!” you shout. “Then he can change me back to normal.”

“I performed on you last night, dear woman?” the magician asked you.

“I'm not a woman,” you growl. “Well, I wasn't one last night at least.”

“Ah, yes!” grinned the magician. “My memory isn't what it once was. Yes, yes. The most holy and sacred rite of Sexus Mutatio Veneficus. It's an ancient ritual, long passed down in secrecy amongst the ancient cabal of alterationists whom I am proud to call my congenial fraternity brothers.”

“You call this stupid sex change parlor trick a holy rite?!” you say rolling your eyes in disbelief.

“We largely operate in secrecy,” said Sen Shu Al conspiratorially. “But perhaps you've heard the whispered tales passed down through history of our great achievements. Orlando was not a piece of fiction, you know!”

“Orlando, Florida?” you ask, confused.

“Orlando the person!” cries Sen Shu Al.

“Orlando Bloom?” you ask, still confused. “What the hell are you going on about you drunken old goat!”

“Coffee: for both of you,” Pam said evenly, carrying out two huge mugs of steaming brew. “Now please keep your voices down. Drunk people on the couches and floors are still trying to sleep.”

“Thanks Pam,” you say taking a sip. “Sorry I snapped at you, Mr. Wizard. It's bad enough waking up with a hangover. You throw in PMS, and its a royal bitch – and right now, so am I. So if you'll please just work your magic again and give my back my … uh … my … you know!”

“Your what?” asks Sen Shu Al. The wizard stares blankly at you for a moment, then starts guzzling at his coffee.

“You know what,” you growl.

“Your penis?” says Sen Shu Al unexcitedly. “Your cock, willy, dick, manhood, stiffy, John Thomas, one-eyed snake, your wife's best friend, your Johnson, your …”

“What are you now: a fucking thesaurus?!” you roar. “Yes! I've got tits and a vagina right now. And I'd like to stop having them, and go back to being a normal guy … like I was before I met you!”

You reach up, grabbing your heavy, round breasts with both hands and jiggle them dramatically to emphasize the point.

“Hmm, yes,” says Sen Shu Al, draining the last few drops of coffee from his mug. “Might I impose upon you dear ladies for a refill?”

“I'm not a lady!” you shout, stomping your foot on the ground.

“I'll get you more,” Pam said, taking the cup from him. “And shhh, you two. Drunk people sleeping, remember?”

“Give me back my genitals,” you hiss at the magician.

“I would be delighted,” he answers with a slight half-bow. “But for one simple problem, I'm afraid: __________.”
152311.title: The Amazing Sen Shu Al

1523111.content:
“Give me back my genitals,” you hiss at the magician.

“I would be delighted,” he answers with a slight half-bow. “But for one simple problem, I'm afraid: The woman with your body parts seems to have absconded with the aforementioned reproductive organs in question.”

“What?” you growl. “You're bluffing. Give me back my manhood.”

“Now, verily good lady! Wherefore wouldst I do such a thing?” says the magician, gesticulating his arms about wildly.

“Speak English, you idiot!” you spit at him.

“Why would I bluff?” he answers with an innocent shrug. “Look around for yourself, good friend. Do you see the young lady-turned-gentleman slumbering anywhere about the room?”

At that moment, Pam returned with a coffee refill for the wizard.

“Pam, where's Lisa Carmen?” you demand.

“What? I don't know. Somewhere around here. Why?” replies Pam, a bit baffled.

“Because Shakespeare the Sorcerer here says she's missing,” you explain. “She's got my … man parts. And I'd kind of like them back.”

“And yet you make such a delightful damsel,” observed Shen Shu Al, admiring your rack while sipping at his coffee. “Have you ever considered just staying female from now on? You'll enjoy an longer average lifespan, can cry in public, don't have to pay for drinks, and get to flee sinking ships before anyone except children.”

“Listen to me very carefully you half-priced Houdini,” you growl, grabbing the magician by the front of his robe and hissing in his face. “I am not going to spend the rest of my life squatting to pee!”

“Brad, wait!” interrupts Pam. “He's right. Lisa isn't here. I've checked throughout the whole place. She's gone.”

“Why would she leave?” you say, releasing your grip on the wizard's robe. “This is her place.”

“Perhaps she went out to procure more ice?” says the magician helpfully.

“I don't think so,” answers Pam. “There's plenty of ice in the kitchen. And anyway, the party's over now. All that's left is for all the drunks to wake up and stumble home.”

“A pity. I certainly could have gone for another apéritif,” muses Shen Shu Al.

“You shut up,” you growl at him. “Pam, do you have Lisa's number? Call her up and see what the hell is going on.”

You find it hard to believe Lisa Carmen would drunkenly agree to swap genitalia with you for the night, and then disappear in the morning absconding with your penis and leaving you the unhappy owner of her tits and vagina … yet improbable as it is, that seems to have been what happened.

“She's not answering her phone,” Pam says. “It just goes straight to voice mail. Where would she have gone?”

“Perhaps she's gone to sow some wild oats,” suggest Shen Shu Al. “Has it occurred to either of you good ladies that perchance Lisa is finding her newly found masculinity far less onerous a condition than poor Brad here finds his femininity distressing.”

“Say what?” you snap at the magician.

“He means Lisa might like being a guy,” translates Pam. “After all, you seemed to enjoy being a girl well enough last night. You and I had fun, right? I sure know I did! So maybe Lisa isn't done … uh … having fun with her new boy bits yet. And if so, there's no telling what … or who she's off doing right now.”
